subject: broken throttle wire
description_text:
What do I need to do? Can the cable be pulled out of the pedal itself and
replaced or is it sodered directly to the pedal?

conversations.body_text: Hi alex ash,  You can visit a nearby computer repair shop to purchase an RJ11 4P4C connector. Ask them to crimp a new connector using a proper crimping tool, making sure the wiring order matches the original exactly. It's a very simple process.

do you guys sell replacement cables?

On Fri, Jun 27, 2025 at 10:53 PM service@simsonn.com
or can the original cable from the pedal not even be replaced?
would it be easier to instead buy this and just plug it into the throttle?

or does the throttle side of the cable not have the rj11 4p4c jack and it’s
just wired directly to the load cell?
Hi alex ash,  Since the wires are already connected inside the sensor, the purchased cable cannot be used directly unless the wires are manually connected.
